definition[1]: used to make sure that someone understands what you are saying
example[1]: I felt very upset, you know?
definition[2]: used when you want to keep someone’s attention, but cannot think of what to say next
example[2]: Well, you know, we’ve got a job to do here.
definition[3]: used when you are explaining or describing something and want to give more information
example[3]: That flower in the garden – you know, the purple one – what is it?
